intro: Lochnera longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered lochnera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Lochnera longifolia is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
